“Mendicants, it’s totally impossible for a mendicant who regards extinguishment as suffering to accept views that agree with the teaching. …

It’s totally possible for a mendicant who regards extinguishment as pleasurable to accept views that agree with the teaching. …”

AN.6.102. Anavatthitasutta (“Transience”)
